title: Public Records Request - Wolf River Boulevard

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the properties at 7550 and 7600 WOLF RIVER Boulevard Germantown TN 38138, please provide the following information: notice and summary of any open zoning, building, and/or fire code violations, or written confirmation that none currently exist; copies of Certificates of Occupancy, or if none are available, please state the reason for their absence and whether the lack of Certificates of Occupancy will result in any enforcement action; and copies of any zoning approval documents, such as approved site plans, conditions of approval, variances, special/conditional use permits, etc. if applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Olivia James

Dear City of Lowell, 

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c.66, §10, I hereby request a copy of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Lowell Public Schools and Lowell Police department on behalf of Citizens for Juvenile Justice, a non-profit advocating for equitable youth justice in MA.  

I am specifically seeking records that detail the collaboration between Lowell Public Schools and Lowell Police Department regarding school resource officers (SROs) and their responsibilities in Lowell Public Schools.  

I request that any fees be waived, as the requested information is in public interest. However, if fees are unavoidable, I would appreciate if you would inform me before fulfilling my request. I would also prefer if the request could be filled electronically via email.  

Thank you for considering my request, I look forward to hearing back within 10 business days.    

 

Joshua Dankoff 

Citizens for Juvenile Justice
